result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmond J Kemp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED DV surcharge, all other NON-MANDATORY and MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Pay all supervision fees

-No contact with firearms.

*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

-No contact with victim M.C.S. unless approved by court.
 Third party contact allowed for purpose of time with the child.
**Court grants expunction if probation is successfully completed**

-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 2
Court ordered defendant to serve 238 days in the House of Correction Concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence, with 238 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

All the costs/surcharges Ordered in the Original sentences Remains the same.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED DV surcharge, all other NON-MANDATORY and MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Pay all supervision fees
File returned to Branch 24 for clarification of Sentencing after Revocation hearing held on 02-03-2017

Defendant Desmond J Kemp in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Desmond J Kemp in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered defendant to serve 238 days in the House of Correction Concurrent to Count 2 but consecutive to any other sentence, with 238 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

PURSUANT TO Felony Division Directive 04-03 dated December 15, 2004 -
As sentencing judge, this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 24, Judge Protasiewicz, for sentencing after revocation of probation.   jm
Received from the Department of Corrections, Request for Sentencing After Revocation of Defendant's Probation.  jm
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant serving ATR.  Review hearing is cancelled. Agent to contact Court to set up review after ATR completed.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 49 DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
Court withheld sentence.  Court placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim M.C.S. unless approved by court. Third party contact allowed for purpose of time with the child. 
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED DV surcharge, all other NON-MANDATORY and MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Pay all supervision fees

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. 

**Court grants expunction if probation is successfully completed**

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Letter from defendant

Probation Review Hearing on 8/26/2016 at 1:30 pm in branch 24.

Defendant Desmond J Kemp in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 


  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court, defendant Desmond J Kemp not in court, in custody.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court, defendant Desmond J Kemp not in court, in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MCS dob 6/18/98

Defendant Desmond J Kemp in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Desmond J Kemp in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  State moves to amend the offense date in the probable cause section of the criminal complaint.  Defense does not object.  Court orders offense date amended to reflect the correct date of January 6, 2016.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
